member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng
member.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the RSA algorithm.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random 2,048-bit key pair.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a randomly generated key of the specified size.
member.param: The size of the key to generate in bits.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key.
member.param: The key to use for RSA operations.
member.exception: key is not a valid RSA key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.RSAEncryptionPadding)
member.summary: Decrypts input data using the specified padding mode.
member.param: The data to decrypt.
The padding mode.
member.returns: The decrypted data.
member.exception: data is null. -or- padding is null.
padding does not equal , or else the of padding does not equal .

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.Encrypt(System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.RSAEncryptionPadding)
member.summary: Encrypts the input data using the specified padding.
member.param: The data to encrypt.
The padding mode.
member.returns: Returns .
member.exception: data is null. -or- padding is null.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.ExportParameters(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the key used by the RSA object into a object.
member.param: true to include private parameters; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The key used by the RSA object.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.ImportParameters(System.Security.Cryptography.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Replaces the existing key that the current instance is working with by creating a new for the parameters structure.
member.param: The RSA parameters.
member.exception: parameters contains neither an exponent nor a modulus.
parameters is not a valid RSA key. -or- parameters is a full key pair and the default KSP is used.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.Key
member.summary: Gets the key that will be used by the object for any cryptographic operation that it performs.
member.returns: The key used by the object.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.SignHash(System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName,System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding)
member.summary: Signs data that was hashed by using the specified hashing algorithm and padding mode.
member.param: The hash to sign.
The hash algorithm name.
The padding mode.
member.returns: The signed data.
member.exception: hash is null. -or- padding is null.
The value of the property of hashAlgorithm is null or .

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACng.VerifyHash(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName,System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding)
member.summary: Verifies data that was signed and already hashed with the specified algorithm and padding mode.
member.param: The hash to verify.
The signature of the data.
The hash algorithm name.
The padding mode.
member.returns: true if the signature verifies for the hash; otherwise, false.
member.exception: hash is null. -or- signature is null. -or- padding is null.
The value of the property of hashAlgorithm is null or .

padding does not equal or . -or- The signature is badly formatted. (In the .NET Framework 4.6 and 4.6.1 only; starting with the .NET Framework 4.6.2, the method returns false if a signature is badly formatted.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng
member.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Triple Data Encryption Standard (3DES) algorithm.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an ephemeral key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key name, which represents an existing persisted 3DES key.
member.param: The name of the key.
member.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) is not supported on this system.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.#ctor(System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.CngProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key name, which represents an existing persisted 3DES key, and the specified key storage provider (KSP).
member.param: The name of the key.
The KSP that contains the key.
member.exception: keyName is null. -or- provider is null.
Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) is not supported on this system.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.#ctor(System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.CngProvider,System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyOpenOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key name, which represents an existing persisted 3DES key, the specified key storage provider (KSP) and key open options.
member.param: The name of the key.
The KSP that contains the key.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specify options for opening the key, such as where the key is opened from (machine or user storage) and whether to suppress UI prompting.
member.exception: keyName is null. -or- provider is null.
Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) is not supported on this system.

rgbKey is a known weak key for this algorithm and cannot be used. -or- rgbIV is null.

rgbKey is a known weak key for this algorithm and cannot be used. -or- rgbIV is null.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng
member.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random key pair.
member.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random key pair, using the specified key size.
member.param: The size of the key. Valid key sizes are 256, 384, and 521 bits.
member.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified object.
member.param: The key that will be used as input to the cryptographic operations performed by the current object.
member.exception: key does not specify an Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) group.
Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class whose public/private key pair is generated over the specified curve.
member.param: The curve used to generate the public/private key pair.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.ExportExplicitParameters(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the key and explicit curve parameters used by the Elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) object into an object.
member.param: true to include private parameters; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The key and explicit curve parameters used by the ECC object.
member.exception: An error occurred while obtaining the curve values.
Explicit export is not supported by this platform. Windows 10 or higher is required.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.ExportParameters(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the key used by the Elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) object into an object. If the key was created as a named curve, the field contains named curve parameters; otherwise, it contains explicit parameters.
member.param: true to include private parameters; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The key and named curve parameters used by the ECC object.
member.exception: An error occurred while obtaining the curve values.

member.summary: Deserializes the key information from an XML string by using the specified format.
member.param: The XML-based key information to be deserialized.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the format of the XML string. The only currently accepted format is .
member.exception: format specifies an invalid format. The only accepted value is .

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.GenerateKey(System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve)
member.summary: Generates a key to use for the ECDsaCng algorithm.
member.param: The curve to use to generate the key.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.HashAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets the hash algorithm to use when signing and verifying data.
member.returns: An object that specifies the hash algorithm.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.ImportParameters(System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters)
member.summary: Replaces the existing key that the current instance is working with by creating a new for the parameters structure.
member.param: The curve parameters.
member.exception: parameters does not contain valid values.
parameters references a curve that cannot be imported.
parameters references a curve that is not supported by this platform.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets the key to use when signing and verifying data.
member.returns: An object that specifies the key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.SignData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Generates a signature for the specified data.
member.param: The message data to be signed.
member.returns: A digital signature for the specified data.
member.exception: The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.SignData(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Generates a signature for the specified data stream, reading to the end of the stream.
member.param: The data stream to be signed.
member.returns: A digital signature for the specified data stream.
member.exception: The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.SignData(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a digital signature for the specified length of data, beginning at the specified offset.
member.param: The message data to be signed.
The location in the string at which to start signing.
The length of the string, in characters, following offset that will be signed.
member.returns: A digital signature for the specified length of data.
member.exception: count or offset caused reading outside the bounds of the data string.
The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.SignHash(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Generates a signature for the specified hash value.
member.param: The hash value of the data to be signed.
member.returns: A digital signature for the specified hash value.
member.exception: The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.ToXmlString(System.Security.Cryptography.ECKeyXmlFormat)
member.summary: Serializes the key information to an XML string by using the specified format.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the format of the XML string. The only currently accepted format is .
member.returns: A string object that contains the key information, serialized to an XML string according to the requested format.
member.exception: format specifies an invalid format. The only accepted value is .

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.VerifyData(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the digital signature of the specified data.

The signature to be verified.
member.returns: true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Verifies the digital signature of the specified data stream, reading to the end of the stream.
member.param: The data stream that was signed.
The signature to be verified.
member.returns: true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.VerifyData(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies a signature for the specified length of data, beginning at the specified offset.
member.param: The data that was signed.
The location in the data at which the signed data begins.
The length of the data, in characters, following offset that will be signed.
The signature to be verified.
member.returns: true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.
member.exception: offset or count is less then zero. -or- offset or count is larger than the length of the byte array passed in the data parameter.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.VerifyHash(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the specified digital signature against a specified hash value.
member.param: The hash value of the data to be verified.
The digital signature of the data to be verified against the hash value.
member.returns: true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies
member.summary: Specifies the key export policies for a key.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies.AllowArchiving
member.summary: The private key can be exported one time for archiving purposes.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies.AllowExport
member.summary: The private key can be exported multiple times.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies.AllowPlaintextArchiving
member.summary: The private key can be exported one time as plaintext.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies.AllowPlaintextExport
member.summary: The private key can be exported multiple times as plaintext.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies.None
member.summary: No export policies are established. Key export is allowed without restriction.

member.summary: Creates a object that can be used with the specified algorithm.

member.returns: An ephemeral key.
member.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) is not supported on this system.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.Create(System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a named object that provides the specified algorithm.

The key name. If a name is not provided, the key will not be persisted.
member.returns: A persisted or ephemeral key that provides the specified algorithm.

One of the enumeration values that indicates whether keyHandle represents an ephemeral key or a named key.

member.summary: A machine-wide key is created.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationOptions.None
member.summary: No key creation options are used.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationOptions.OverwriteExistingKey
member.summary: The existing key is overwritten during key creation.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters
member.summary: Contains advanced properties for key creation.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.ExportPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets the key export policy.
member.returns: An object that specifies a key export policy. The default value is null, which indicates that the key storage provider's default export policy is set.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.KeyCreationOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the key creation options.
member.returns: An object that specifies options for creating keys. The default value is null, which indicates that the key storage provider's default key creation options are set.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.KeyUsage
member.summary: Gets or sets the cryptographic operations that apply to the current key.
member.returns: A bitwise combination of one or more enumeration values that specify key usage. The default value is null, which indicates that the key storage provider's default key usage is set.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.Parameters
member.summary: Enables a object to be created with additional properties that are set before the key is finalized.
member.returns: A collection object that contains any additional parameters that you must set on a object during key creation.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.ParentWindowHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the window handle that should be used as the parent window for dialog boxes that are created by Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes.
member.returns: The HWND of the parent window that is used for CNG dialog boxes.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.Provider
member.summary: Gets or sets the key storage provider (KSP) to create a key in.
member.returns: An object that specifies the KSP that a new key will be created in.
member.exception: The property is set to a null value.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.UIPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets information about the user interface to display when a key is created or accessed.
member.returns: An object that contains details about the user interface shown by Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes when a key is created or accessed. A null value indicates that the key storage provider's default user interface policy is set.

The full-text description of the key. Specify a null string to use the default description.
A description of how the key will be used. Specify a null string to use the default description.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.CngUIProtectionLevels
member.summary: Specifies the protection level for the key in user interface (UI) prompting scenarios.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngUIProtectionLevels.ForceHighProtection
member.summary: A UI prompt is displayed every time the key is accessed.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngUIProtectionLevels.None
member.summary: No UI prompt is displayed when the key is accessed.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CngUIProtectionLevels.ProtectKey
member.summary: A UI prompt is displayed the first time the key is accessed in a process.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng
member.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA).

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random 2,048-bit key pair.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a randomly generated key of the specified size.
member.param: The size of the key to generate in bits.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key.
member.param: The key to use for DSA operations.
member.exception: key is not a valid DSA key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.CreateSignature(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates the digital signature for the specified data.
member.param: The data to be signed.
member.returns: The digital signature for the specified data.
member.exception: rgbHash is shorter in length than the Q value of the DSA key .

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.ExportParameters(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the DSA algorithm parameters.
member.param: true to include private parameters; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The DSA algorithm parameters.
member.exception: DSA key is not a valid public or private key.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.ImportParameters(System.Security.Cryptography.DSAParameters)
member.summary: Replaces the existing key that the current instance is working with by creating a new for the parameters structure.
member.param: The DSA parameters.
member.exception: The specified DSA parameters are not valid.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.Key
member.summary: Gets the key that will be used by the object for any cryptographic operation that it performs.
member.returns: The key used by the object to perform cryptographic operations.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.KeyExchangeAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets the name of the key exchange algorithm.
member.returns: Always null.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.LegalKeySizes

member.returns: An array that contains the key sizes supported by the algorithm.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.SignatureAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets the name of the signature algorithm.
member.returns: The string "DSA".

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.VerifySignature(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies if the specified digital signature matches the specified data.
member.param: The signed data.
The digital signature to be verified.
member.returns: true if rgbSignature matches the signature computed using the specified data; otherwise, false.
member.exception: The rgbHash parameter is null. -or- The rgbSignature parameter is null.
rgbHash is shorter in length than the Q value of the DSA key .
